title: France prepares for unpredictable municipal elections, one year before presidential vote
subhed: Local officials fear the national political crisis will have a ripple effect on the upcoming municipal elections in March. Three-way and four-way runoffs are expected to be widespread, paving the way for political realignments just months before the crucial 2027 presidential contest.

title: Putin and US envoy Witkoff begin talks in Moscow
Zelensky blasts EU at Davos, claims US security guarantees for Ukraine are ready
Iranians in Turkey flee repression and bear witness to the bloodshed in their country
subhed: The brutal response of the Iranian regime against protesters has led many Iranians to seek refuge in neighboring Turkey. Their stories attest to the cruelty that the authorities have shown since the beginning of the protest movement.

title: Tenants are less well-housed than homeowners, says latest INSEE report
subhed: The 2024 housing conditions survey shows that the proportion of homeowner households (57%) and tenant households (40%) has changed little over the past decade. The latter are more exposed to overcrowding and housing defects.

title: French say they love art, but rarely visit exhibitions
subhed: An Ipsos-BVA survey for Beaux Arts Magazine, released on Thursday, reveals the public's taste for contemporary art but a limited knowledge of living artists.

title: Dior and Vuitton: The question of innovation at Paris men's fashion week
subhed: For the fall-winter 2026-2027 menswear collections, presented in Paris through January 25, Pharrell Williams designed an everyday wardrobe at Vuitton, while Jonathan Anderson offered a new vision for Dior menswear.

title: Two reports accuse Israel of deliberately destroying Gaza's reproductive health system

How surveillance companies track smartphone users through advertising data

Europe relieved but 'vigilant' as Trump eases pressure on Greenland
Who are Greenlanders and what do they really want?
subhed: Greenland, which is bigger than France, the UK, Germany and Spain combined, has a population of 57,000, most of whom are Inuit. They are also Danish citizens, a legacy of Denmark's colonization of the territory that began in the 18th century.
byline: By Constance Derouin, Arthur Navet  (motion design) and Sinead McCausland

title: 'As it ceases to inspire, the US is losing part of itself'
subhed: Donald Trump's second term has turned the United States into a threat to which the rest of the world has no choice but to adapt. Yet, over the past eight decades, habits and practices have taken root that will be used to counter this new imperialism, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: In the Ukrainian Carpathians, peace feels both near and far
subhed: In Uzhhorod, a border city near Slovakia, exhausted and disillusioned residents have long stopped believing in victory and expect little from ongoing diplomatic talks. They only hope that the war will end, even 'if it means sacrificing a piece of the country to be saved.'
byline: By Florence Aubenas (Uzhhorod, Ukraine, special correspondent)

title: A brief respite in the transatlantic crisis
Golshifteh Farahani, Iranian actress: 'Resisting horror, dictatorships and invaders is in our blood'
A 'Board of Peace,' to do what?
